page.title: 17JODRELL BANK (ASTRONOMY)
page.content:
Jodrell Bank is the site of Manchester University's Nuffield Radio Astronomy laboratories. It contains the 250 foot radio telescope which is visible for miles around.
This telescope was completed in 1957 and came to public attention almost immediately when it made observations on Sputnik 1, man's first object in space.
The main function of Jodrell Bank is in making observations for research into the origins and composition of the universe. The telescope's size allows it to measure very weak radio signals. To accurately discriminate between close objects its observations are compared, by computer, with those made by other radio telescopes in Cheshire, Europe or even the USA.
